children.name: Example
children.text: // get the same values using getAttribute gs.info(connectionInfo.getAttribute("name")); gs.info(connectionInfo.getAttribute("connection_url"));

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of a ConnectionInfo object property.

children.name: String
children.text: Value of a specified ConnectionInfo property.

children.name: getAttribute(String name)
children.text: Returns the value of a ConnectionInfo attribute with the specified property name.

children.name: Example
children.text: // get credential attributes gs.info(connectionInfo.getCredentialAttribute("user_name")); gs.info(connectionInfo.getCredentialAttribute("password"));

children.name: Object
children.text: Key-value pair map of credential attributes.

children.name: getCredentialAttribute()
children.text: Returns the value of credential attributes for a specified connection.

children.name: Example
children.text: // get data map var datamap = connectionInfo.getDataMap(); gs.info(datamap["name"]); gs.info(datamap["connection_url"]);

children.name: Object
children.text: Key-value pair map of connection attributes.

children.name: getDataMap()
children.text: Returns the connection attributes as a collection of key-value pairs.

children.name: Example
children.text: // get extended attributes var extendedAttributes = connectionInfo.getExtendedAttributes(); gs.info(extendedAttributes["name1"]); }

children.name: Object
children.text: Key-value pair map of extended attributes.

children.name: getExtendedAttributes()
children.text: Returns the extended attributes as a collection of key-value pairs.

name: ConnectionInfo - Scoped, Global
text: Use the ConnectionInfo API to get connection attribute information through the connection and credential alias.

children.name: ConnectionInfoProvider()
children.text:
Use ConnectionInfoProvider() to select connection information through the connection
    alias.

children.name: Example
children.text: var provider = new sn_cc.ConnectionInfoProvider(); // get a jdbc connection in the current domain with the alias ID // "6219afbf9f03320021dd7501942e70fc" var connectionInfo = provider.getConnectionInfo("6219afbf9f03320021dd7501942e70fc");

children.name: ConnectionInfo
children.text: Information about the connection.

children.name: aliasID
children.text: String
children.text2: The sys_id of a connection alias.

children.name: getConnectionInfo(String aliasID)
children.text:
This function retrieves a ConnectionInfo object identified by the given aliasID in the
    current domain.

children.name: aliasID
children.text: String
children.text2: The sys_id of a connection alias.

children.name: Example
children.text: var provider = new sn_cc.ConnectionInfoProvider(); // get a jdbc connection in the ACME domain with the alias ID // "cd5923ff9f03320021dd7501942e70bb" connectionInfo = provider.getConnectionInfoByDomain("cd5923ff9f03320021dd7501942e70bb", "c90d4b084a362312013398f051272c0d");

children.name: ConnectionInfo
children.text: Connection information.

children.name: domainID
children.text: String
children.text2: The sys_id of a domain or global.

children.name: getConnectionInfoByDomain(String aliasID, String domainID)
children.text:
This function retrieves a ConnectionInfo object identified by the given aliasID for a
    specific domain.

name: ConnectionInfoProvider - Scoped, Global
text: Use the ConnectionInfoProvider API to select connection information through the connection alias.

children.name: Example
children.text: var provider = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider(); var credentials = provider.getCredentialByID("ef43c6d40a0a0b5700c77f9bf387afe3");

children.name: StandardCredentialsProvider()
children.text: Instantiates a credentials provider object.

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of the credential record. Located in the Credentials
                [discovery_credentials] table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var provider = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider(); var credentials = provider.getCredentialByID("ef43c6d40a0a0b5700c77f9bf387afe3"); gs.info("User name: " + credentials.getAttribute("user_name"));

children.name: StandardCredential
children.text: Credential record object.

children.name: getCredentialByID(String sys_id)
children.text: Returns the credential record object identified by the specified sys_id.

children.name: Example
children.text: var provider = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider(); var credentials = provider.getCredentials(["ssh"]);
children.text2: This code  shows how to get the provider credentials for "ssh" credential types.

children.name: StandardCredential
children.text: Credential record object.

children.name: tags
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Comma-separated list of tag names. For example, "ssh, jdbc".
Examples of valid calls:
  • var credentials = provider.getCredentials(null, null);
  • var credentials = provider.getCredentials(["ssh"], "");
  • var credentials = provider.getCredentials(new ArrayList<String>(), "ssh,admin");

children.name: types
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Optional. Credential type names. For example, ["ssh", "windows"]
Note: If types is null or empty, any match returns a credential. If types is specified, the credentials whose type matches one of the types is returned.

children.name: Example
children.text: var provider = new sn_cc.StandardCredentialsProvider(); ArrayList<String> types = new ArrayList<>(); types.add("ssh"); types.add("windows"); JSONArray jsonArray = provider.getCredentials(types, "admin");
children.text2:
This code  shows how to get the provider credentials for "ssh" and "windows"
        credential types that have tags of "admin".

children.name: getCredentials(String types, String tags)
children.text:
Returns an array of all credentials that match the specified types and
    tags.

name: StandardCredentialsProvider - Scoped, Global
text: Use the StandardCredentialsProvider API to retrieve credential information.
